AttackModel.Objective: Compromise the web server and obtain the flag.

Attacker.Motivation: Gain unauthorized access to the system and extract sensitive information (flag).
Capabilities: Ability to craft malicious HTTP requests

Vulnerabilities: Command injection through PHP system() function
Security Measures: Input validation for the 'statement' parameter missing

Actions: Observe the web page with an online calculator
Submit a simple calculation (1+1) to see how the server responds

AttackSteps.Description: Trigger an error in the application
Discover the usage of PHP eval() function
Actions: Observe the error message indicating the use of eval()
Identify that user input is directly used in eval()

AttackSteps.Description: Exploit PHP eval() for command injection
Actions: Craft a statement that executes a system command: statement=system('id')

AttackSteps.Description: Execute a command and retrieve user information
Actions: Submit the crafted statement to the application

AttackSteps.Description: List directory contents to gather information
Actions: Craft a statement to list directory contents: statement=system('ls -al')
Submit the crafted statement to the application

AttackSteps.Description: Retrieve the flag by reading the 'index.php' file
Actions: Craft a statement to read the 'index.php' file: statement=system('cat index.php')
Submit the crafted statement to the application

AttackSteps.Description: Locate the flag in the 'index.php' file
Actions: Inspect the response for the flag: auctf{p6p_1nj3c7i0n_iz_k3wl}
